content:
Hi Joe,

What does the error message say?

When you set up the account, were your user name and password accepted?

Where and how did you block Thunderbird from accessing your contacts? Contacts where? In iCloud?

Please report your incoming and outgoing server settings. Incoming server settings are in account settings > server settings. Outgoing server settings are in account settings > click on account name > edit SMTP server.

We will need this information for each server:

server name port connection security method authentication method username: just report if whether or not you are using your full e-mail address

creator: davidhealer4

content:
Hi Jesper,

The error was trying to re-use the previous account and just changing some settings. One has to add the new account, transfer messages from the old account either to local folders or the new account, and then disable or delete the old account.

The new account seems to be an IMAP account. Is it? IMAP synchronizes folders with the server. When you had your inbox and other folders access the new account, those folders were synchronized with the new account.

But I do not understand why you can find messages from the old account by searching for them or why the names of all the folders are preserved in the folderTree.json file. So my diagnosis could be wrong.

I believe that you have two options:

  1. Re-connect to the old account if you still can, and start this process over.
  2. Restore from a back-up.

Maybe a third option: if your old account was a POP account, I understand that those messages are still on your local drive. Was it a POP account?
creator: mozilla98

content:
Poškozený index složky (NEJČASTĚJŠÍ PŘÍČINA). Thunderbird má zprávy fyzicky stažené, ale index složky je rozbitý.

Postup (bezpečný – o maily nepřijdete): Pravým tlačítkem klikněte na složku Doručená pošta (Inbox) u účtu Atlas Zvolte Vlastnosti Klikněte na Opravit složku Potvrďte a vyčkejte (může trvat i několik minut) Restartujte Thunderbird

Ve většině případů se zprávy okamžitě objeví.
creator: Ansamb

content: Včera večer jsem updatoval na verzi 147 a stejný problém. Dnes v cca 11 hod se to rozjelo a konečně zobrazuje zprávy via IMAP z imap.atlas.cz. Jediné, co jsem zkoušel, bylo ve webovém rozhraní v nastavení pošty zakázání POP3 a IMAP a po té zase nastavil povolení IMAP, ale nechal zakázané POP3 (POP3 jsem pak nepovolil spíše z bezpečnostního důvodu, kdybych někdy dostal blbý nápad zprovoznit POP3). Ale nemyslím si, že to s tím souviselo (tyto dvě události měly od sebe odstup přes hodinu ...jedině že by se v nějakém intervalu načítalo nastavení na serveru Atlasu a ty změny to "profoukly" ...ale nemyslím si). Mezi tím jsem zkusil i novější (beta) verzi a bez pokroku. Co se změnilo netuším. Ale jsem moc rád, že to zase jede.

Kedves Gábor!

Konkrétan ugyanazt a funkcionalitást nem tudja az androidos alkalmazás, de a beérkezett üzeneteket tudod egyesített módon kezelni.

A Beállítások -> Általános beállítások -> Megjelenés oldalon, a Fióklista szakaszban kapcsold be az Egységes beérkezett üzenetek megjelenítése lehetőséget. Ezután ez is megjelenik a fióklistában. Lásd a mellékelt képeket.

Üdv, Balázs

Üdvözlettel, Gábor

content:
Yes, this kind of filter should work in Thunderbird.

After you select Tools > Message filters and then select the name of the filter, what folder is set for it to operate on (bottom of the window)?

There seems to be quirks in Thunderbirds message filtering. If you create a filter to run on Folder A, then run it manually when you are looking at Folder B, Thunderbird changes the folder that it is set to operate on.

You may find other useful information here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters
creator: mozilla98

content: I do not see anything wrong. Maybe someone else can help.
creator: mozilla98

content:
I wouldn't think the "Periodically..." option would be necessary, since the filter has already checked the message during fetching. Also, I'm surprised the filter works when you manually run it, even though the "Manually Run" option is disabled.

I would create a test filter identical to this one but use Subject criteria like "TESTTEST1", "TESTTEST2", "TESTTEST3", and send myself some test messages to see if they work. I might also change the action to something else, like 'Tag Message' or 'Move Message To'.

There is the "Filter Log" feature that you can enable in the Message Filters dialog that might show where things are going wrong.

creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: If Eclipse is shutting down, I expect anyone attempting to send you an email there will have it rejected/returned because Eclipse won't be there to redirect - and that only works when an email provider has that feature. Your survival strategy needs to be sending emails to everyone you care about with the new email address. That's the best you can do. As far as transferring the messages, That's probably best done by you.If volume is small, you may be able to simply highlight the account folders, rightclick and select 'COPY to' the gmail account. (NEVER use move for IMAP to IMAP.) A safe way is to use file>offline>download to ensure you capture all messages, use the addon, importexporttools NG to highlight folder, righclick, export to mbox file, and then highlight Local Folders, rightclick and use the importexportoption to import mbox. That gets the messages safely to your PC, Check that you have all the content, not just headers. Now, you can highlight the local messages, select COPY to ' the gmail folders. If there are thousands of messages, I suggest using a manual filter to regulate the transfer.
creator: davidsk

Automatic on the Inbox only has been standard since the birth of TB, although extending it to other folders has been discussed: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=428574

You might be able to achieve the desired effect by creating one or more filters with multiple rules (match any/all of the following).

creator: siffemoz

content:
I found an article which is nearly correct. Here is my correct solution:

Turn off and disable ALL junk filtering

1. Go to account name at upper left, above Inbox and below “+New Message”. 2. Right click on that 3.Go to “Settings” which is the last entry in the drop down menu. 4. Go to “Junk Settings” 5. UNCHECK “Enable adaptive junk mail controls for this account” 6. Go back later and confirm that the box is still uncecked. 7. Go further down to “Junk Settings” in “Local Folders” and do the same thing (usually this is the same screen as before and usually will be unchecked already).

The article at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1061256#answer-726506 has nearly correct instructions.
creator: slemberg
